title: What is the theory of signatures in Paracelsian medicine and how does it relate to disease and healing?
first_phrase: In the previous portion of this article on "EARNIACO E VELENO", the author discusses the idea of "processi ambivalenti" and their effects on health. In this final part, the author clarifies the common diagnostic confusion when attempting to identify the "signatura" or individuality of symptoms that present in a disease. By understanding and intuitively interpreting the "signatura," one can better diagnose and treat the patient. The author also mentions the practical application of this concept in a special branch of therapy. The article references the works of Paracelso, a Swiss physician known for his belief that the power of poison is akin to that of medicine.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the concept of signatura and corresponding it to the right force that reacts to eliminate the cause of illness is the primary task of accurate diagnosis. Paracelsus' theory suggests that the power of poison is similar to medicine, and that healing is possible when the signature of the reacting force is identified and enhanced by a similar power. This principle of correspondence also applies to the selection of substances with similar signatures. Knowing this can aid in the appropriate use of medication and potentially potentiate the body's natural healing abilities.
